attributes.description: Maximum flow rate delivered to the cabin.
attributes.name: maximumAirFlowRate

attributes.description: Range of acceptable oxygen levels in the air supply.
attributes.name: oxygenConcentrationRange

attributes.description: Noise level generated by the system during operation.
attributes.name: operationalNoiseLevel

attributes.description: Efficiency of particulate filtration within the system.
attributes.name: filtrationEfficiency

designScenario.description: The Air Supply System is an integral component that ensures proper distribution and quality of air inside the aircraft, maintaining passenger comfort and safety. It addresses air circulation, purification, and conditioning requirements to meet stringent aviation standards.
designScenario.name: Air Supply System

details.description: The system must distribute air evenly throughout all cabin zones while maintaining required pressure and temperature.
Filter airborne contaminants with at least a 99% efficiency level through a high-performance filter module.
Handle peak airflow demands of up to 2000 CFM under full cabin occupancy.
The noise generated by the air supply unit should not exceed 55 dB to ensure passenger comfort.
The system's design should facilitate regular maintenance and component replacement without requiring extensive downtime.

relationships.description: The Air Handling Unit collects and supplies conditioned air to the Distribution Unit.
The Filtration Module processes the air delivered by the Handling Unit to remove contaminants.

systemComponents.description: Unit responsible for processing and conditioning the air before distribution.
systemComponents.name: Air Handling Unit

subComponents.description: Fan mechanism generating airflow throughout the system.
subComponents.name: Supply Fan

subComponents.description: Heat exchanger module for conditioning air temperature.
subComponents.name: Heat Exchanger

systemComponents.description: Filters air to remove particles and impurities, ensuring high indoor air quality.
systemComponents.name: Filtration Module

subComponents.description: High-Efficiency Particulate Air (HEPA) filter ensuring clean air supply.
subComponents.name: HEPA Filter

systemComponents.description: Distributes the processed air evenly into the aircraft cabin zones.
systemComponents.name: Distribution Unit

subComponents.description: Air outlets delivering supply air into specific cabin sections.
subComponents.name: Air Outlets

comments.body: The Air Supply System is responsible for maintaining cabin environmental control through proper air flow.
Defines the operating temperature range for the Air Supply System.

rag_context: Air Handling Unit (AHU) is a critical subsystem within the Environmental Control System designed for passenger airplanes. It specifies the airflow capacity delivered by the Air Handling Unit, ensuring sufficient ventilation and mixing across the cabin. The optimal operating temperature range for reliable performance under various flight conditions is 10째C - 40째C. The system's compatible pressure range ensures proper integration with the overall cabin environmental control, ranging from 0.8 atm to 1.2 atm. The noise level emitted by the unit during operation is low to moderate, which is important for passenger comfort. The recommended maintenance cycle to ensure long-term reliability and safety is every 500 flight hours.
